intro: Galium nuttallii subsp. insulare, commonly known as the island bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Galium nuttallii subsp. insulare is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms.
